trans-unit.source: Stores the font format attributes.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat> class is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter> class.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This constructor looks first to the given style for the values of <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Bold%2A><xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Italic%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Size%2A>.

If any of the corresponding properties of the `style` are <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BooleanOption.NotSet>, this constructor looks to the corresponding properties of the `currentFormat` parameter.
The style to create the new formatter from.
The format to create the new formatter from.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` to set format to bold; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to set format to italic; otherwise, `false`.
The font size to be used in writing.
Sets or returns whether the font is bold.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontSize.NotSet"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Bold%2A> property takes a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BooleanOption> enumeration, not a Boolean value.
`true` if the font is bold; otherwise, `false`.

Compares a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat"></xref> object to the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Compare%2A> method is called internally by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter> class.
The format object to compare.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Bold"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Italic"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Size"></xref> properties have the same values in both <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat"></xref> objects; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is italic.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontSize.NotSet"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.Italic%2A> property takes a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BooleanOption> enumeration, not a Boolean value.
`true` if the font is italic; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the specified font size.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Must be of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontSize>.
The default value is <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontSize.NotSet>.
An enumerated value representing the size of the font.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text was written with the bold attribute.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.WrittenBold%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat> class are used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter> class.
`true` if the text was written with the bold attribute; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text was written with the italic attribute.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.WrittenItalic%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat> class are used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter> class.
`true` if the text was written with the italic attribute; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text was written with the size attribute.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat.WrittenSize%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat> class are used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter> class.
`true` if the text was written with the size attribute; otherwise, `false`.
